name: Aurora Indica
description: Aurora Indica, bred by Nirvana Seeds, is a 90% indica cross between Afghan and Northern Lights. Fulfilling our expectations of an indica, this strain induces heavy full-body effects and a sedating cerebral calm. Aurora Indica is a potent strain for evening treatment of insomnia, pain, and other conditions requiring a restful night’s sleep. The short plants produce dense, bulky buds dusted in a thick layer of crystal resin. Different phenotypes emerge under different growing conditions, giving way to variable bud structures and aromas ranging from fruity to floral. Nirvana Seeds recommends a 9 to 11-week flowering time for indoor gardens, or a mid-September harvest for outdoor growers.
descriptionPlain: Aurora Indica, bred by Nirvana Seeds, is a 90% indica cross between Afghan and Northern Lights. Fulfilling our expectations of an indica, this strain induces heavy full-body effects and a sedating cerebral calm. Aurora Indica is a potent strain for evening treatment of insomnia, pain, and other conditions requiring a restful night’s sleep. The short plants produce dense, bulky buds dusted in a thick layer of crystal resin. Different phenotypes emerge under different growing conditions, giving way to variable bud structures and aromas ranging from fruity to floral. Nirvana Seeds recommends a 9 to 11-week flowering time for indoor gardens, or a mid-September harvest for outdoor growers.

highlightedReviews.text:
My Aurora Indica was grown from seed in 80/20 Perlite/Vermiculite with an 8 week veg cycle. Each plant was topped once at 4 weeks. 3 plants produced nearly 450g total. Good leaf to bud ratio. Dense bud structure even under a T5. Strong branching required no support. Harvested with cloudy and amber trichomes. Sticky even after months of curing. Gums up a grinder quickly.

With such a generous yield I was able to try cooking as well as vaping and a couple smoke tokes. I'm typically a nonsmoker but wanted to compare.

Vapor and smoke flavor are quite neutral all around. Perhaps leaning on the slightly spicey/hashy side of the pallette. Effect comes on swift but smooth quickly easing into total couchlock. No real head trip effect or paranoia. Overall body and calming effect was strong for 3 to 4 hours and gently faded for another hour or so.

AI is fantastic for night time use. It eased my anxiety, agitation and ruminating during the day but the heavy stone prevented me from being productive. Good for helping one to fall asleep and stay asleep. Not so great for wake n bake unless you're staying home and your to do list is done.

This is a heavily Indica dominant strain that means business. Easy to grow indoors. Average looks and taste. Deep couch lock stone.

articles.title: New Strains Alert: Plushberry, Dogwalker OG, Aurora Indica, and Brains Damage
articles.author: Bailey Rahn
articles.text:
Most cannabis varieties are adept relaxants, but if you’re prone to anxiety and paranoia, finding the right strain can be more difficult. We’ve added four new varieties particularly effective for reducing stress without that unpleasant paranoid edge: please welcome Plushberry, Dogwalker OG, Aurora Indica, and Brains Damage. Be sure to leave a review if you’ve had the pleasure of trying one of these indica or hybrid strains!
1. Plushberry
Characteristics of Plushberry:

80% indica
A cross between Black Cherry Soda and Space Queen
Breeder: TGA Seeds
Berry aroma
Brings deep relaxation and stress relief
Flowers in 55 to 65 days

2. Dogwalker OG
Characteristics of Dogwalker OG:

Balanced hybrid strain
A hybrid of Albert Walker OG and Chemdawg 91
Woody, skunky aroma
Brings stress relief, focus, and relaxation
Commonly used for pain, mood disorders, and appetite loss

3. Aurora Indica
Characteristics of Aurora Indica:

90% indica
Cross between Afghan and Northern Lights
Breeder: Nirvana Seeds
Fruity, floral, woody aroma
Brings heavy full-body effects and a sedating cerebral calm
Good for evening treatment of insomnia and pain
9 to 11 week flowering time

4. Brains Damage
Characteristics of Brains Damage:

Sativa-dominant hybrid
Cross between Acapulco Mexican, Mango, Hawaiian, and KC 36
Breeder: KC Brains
Sweet, fruity, earthy aroma
Brings cerebrally-focused, mellow, and relaxing effects
8-10 week flowering time
